title: FPS IN LEAGUE
body:
Hello guys
This post is about your FPS in league. Now I am no computer whiz as my older brother is the one who builds our computer and that. I would like to know what is the benefit of a higher fps. I play wtih 60 fps and I have no problems however when I turn off one setting it can go up to 170 -180 fps is there any benefit in this? 
Regards Jomoko2012

replies.body: If your monitor is 60 hz refresh rate (most laptops and monitors) then you can mainly only see 60 fps anyway.

FPS just makes it look better. Capping the FPS so that it is stable rather than changing slightly can help you play better.

Some people can argue that a higher fps allows you to see skillshots and stuff better, but its really subjective.

Any benefits of FPS is limited by both what your monitor is capable of processing and what you're capable of identifying. As far as I know the highest FPS a human can identify is about 150 FPS, though it may be lower depending on the individual. As far as monitors go, as long as the frequency/refresh rate of the monitor matches the FPS you're good (so 60 Hz for 60 FPS, 120 Hz for 120 FPS and so on).
